page.title: 05Market Gardening
page.content: To the East of Joydens Wood Estate, the land is covered with orchards, fields & woodland and there are nurseries. {St.Mary's Nursery}8.5 acres, grows and sells mainly bedding plants but shrubs, pot plants, small Xmas trees lettuces, cucumbers & peppers are also grown. The nursery shop buys in fruit and vegetables to attract more customers. {Ashlea Nursery}6 acres. Used to grow tomatoes, now grows only summer & autumn flowers which go to Covent Garden. Also supplies offices, hotels and restarants with indoor landscaping. {Wallis Nursery}12 acres, grows mostly flowers, Chrysanthemums the most popular. Flowers delivered to Covent Garden at least twice a week. by J Griffiths.
